Local Network Gateway

Azure Local Network Gateway represents your on-premises VPN device and network in Azure. Itâ€™s a crucial component when configuring site-to-site VPN connections between your Azure Virtual Network and on-premises infrastructure.

Topics

Benefits of Azure Local Network Gateway

Hybrid Connectivity

Acts as the Azure-side representation of your on-premises VPN appliance, allowing Azure to initiate and maintain a secure IPsec VPN tunnel.

Client VPN

AWS Client VPN is a managed, scalable VPN service that enables secure, remote access to AWS resources and on-premises networks using OpenVPN-based clients. It eliminates the need for self-managed VPN servers.

Topics

Benefits of Client VPN

Scalable Remote Access

Easily scale to hundreds or thousands of remote users without worrying about infrastructure capacity or maintenance.

Site-to-Site VPN

AWS Site-to-Site VPN connects your on-premises network or other cloud environments to AWS using secure IPSec tunnels over the internet.

Topics

Key Features

  • Two redundant tunnels per VPN connection.
  • Integrates with Virtual Private Gateway or Transit Gateway.
  • Supports static or BGP routing.
  • Encrypted, secure tunnels.

Benefits

  • Quick hybrid cloud connectivity.
  • No need for Direct Connect for simple setups.
  • Works with most on-prem VPN devices.

Use Cases

  • Extend on-prem data centers to AWS.
  • Backup network path to AWS alongside Direct Connect.
  • Secure partner connectivity.

Best Practices

  • Use BGP for dynamic routing and failover.
  • Monitor tunnel health with CloudWatch.
  • Combine with Direct Connect for reliability.
  • Enable CloudHub for connecting multiple sites.
